topics.body:
"@EHAN":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f1056c6368721a88e70000#post_54f1056c6368721a88e70000
Not really.

Granted me and the persons I was arguing against were getting angry at each other they believed that scientists were "misogynistic" and that they should be removed and replaced.  Let that set in for a second; they legitimately believe that the best way to fight "misogyny" in the scientific community would be to fire every last say nuclear technician and replace them with non-qualified individuals to handle nuclear reactors.

I'm not joking about the latter either; I asked the person in question if they believed that nuclear technicians should be en masse fired and replaced with non-certified individuals for the sake of "equality" and they responded with a 100% straight face that yes they did believe that and that they believed "the new people could receive on site training" "if you fired all the previous personel who would they receive training from?" "they could read the manuals; how hard could it be?"
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
Had lunch with two friends when all of a sudden one of them asked if I was a brony. I figured that in knowing the person the wisest choice was to say no. And then I was treated to a lovely conversation in which she informed me that they all wanted to fuck horses and little children because of what she had read on Tumblr. When I questioned getting info from Tumblr, the second friend jumped in and told me Google confirmed it as well.

It was kind of awkward. I pushed my Derpy keychain further into my pocket as the conversation went on.
topics.author: 5041b54f7f123b77af00a442

topics.body:
"@And Brother I Hurt People":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54f10a08636872649e404400#post_54f10a08636872649e404400
If you're going out with friends, NEVER take anything MLP related.
Seriously.
Even if your friends knew and accepted that, you still have the public around you.

Man, you reminded me of a commerical where a woman believed EVERYTHING on the Internet was true, and went out with a guy who told her he was a "French model."
